page.title: 04EDUCATION
page.content: Meonstoke C.of E. Controlled Infants School currently has 19 pupils. It was built in 1842 as a National School. There are now 2 fulltime teachers, one part time teacher, two cooks and a cleaner. Most of the local children begin their school career here, leaving at 8 years old to attend Droxford Junior School, (some opt for Ridgemede Junior School, Bishop's Waltham) followed by Swanmore Comprehensive school. The children are are transported to Droxford and Swanmore on a school bus.The designated 6th Form College is in Eastleigh. Our village school is regarded as a most important aspect of our community. A Pre School Play Group is held 3 times per week in The Meon Hall.
